Zombie JVM may stay alive after RAC is shut down -- subsequent restarts of the 
RAC fail b/c the zombie is hanging on to the port.  The following exception is 
shown when the RAC is restarted:

java.net.BindException: Address already in use: bind
        at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Native Method)
        at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind
(ServerSocketChannelImpl.java:124)
        at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(ServerSocketAdaptor.java:86)
        at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(ServerSocketAdaptor.java:79)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.file.FileServerExtended.run
(FileServerExtended.java:148)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.file.FileServer.run
(FileServer.java:61)
Need to verify that the fixes put in this weekend address this problem.

Problem still exists in latest build.  Additional debugging suggests that this 
is the not the file server java process (which we expect to see as dll based 
JVM), but is a NodeImpl launched RAC java process which is somehow hanging on 
to the file transfer port.

I will work to find a fix today and am cautiously optomistic.  Fallback plan 
is to roll back all of the file transfer enhancement, which we would greatly 
prefer not to do.
